title: shortDescription
content: Mammography uses low-dose X-rays to acquire high-resolution images of breast tissue for cancer screening, diagnosis, and disease monitoring.

title: Modality Name
content: Mammography (Conventional Mammography, Digital Mammography, Tomosynthesis, Contrast-enhanced Mammography)

title: Imaging Principle
content: Mammography acquires images using low-dose X-rays to capture detailed breast tissue images for early cancer detection. Tomosynthesis reconstructs 3D volumes, and contrast-enhanced approaches highlight functional vascular differences.

title: Primary File Format(s)
content: DICOM (.dcm), JPEG (.jpg, .jpeg), JPEG 2000 (.jp2, .j2k), TIFF (.tif, .tiff), PNG (.png), HDF5 (.h5)

title: Data Type
content: Grayscale 2D imaging, 3D Volumetric Imaging (DBT), Time-Series (CESM), Functional Imaging (CEM, MBI)

title: Conversion Solutions + Reference
content: Convert JPEG images to DICOM using Python libraries like pydicom, Pillow, and numpy. Process includes reading image, converting pixel data, creating DICOM metadata, and saving.
Convert JPEG 2000 images to DICOM using glymur (for image reading), numpy, and pydicom. Includes metadata assignment and pixel data conversion.
Use Pillow, numpy, and pydicom to convert TIFF to DICOM. Process includes image reading, conversion to numpy array, DICOM metadata creation, and export.
Replace pixel data in an existing DICOM with PNG data using Pillow and pydicom. Metadata such as image dimensions and pixel format is updated accordingly.
Convert BMP images to DICOM using VTK's vtkBMPReader and vtkGDCMImageWriter. Handles lookup tables if needed and saves multi-frame or single-frame datasets.
Convert cine loops to multi-frame DICOM using ffmpeg to extract frames and pydicom to build DICOM datasets with appropriate metadata.

title: Voxel Size / Pixel Spacing
content: Pixel sizes between 50 and 100 µm (e.g., 0.1 mm × 0.1 mm). Reference: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/3623862/

title: Typical Study Size
content: Screening: 30–200 MB; DBT: 800 MB–2.6 GB. Reference: https://ajronline.org/doi/10.2214/AJR.14.12912

title: Equipment Used
content: Mammography units (X-ray tube, compression paddle, image receptor), DBT systems, CAD systems. Reference: https://breast-cancer-research.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/bcr236

title: Typical Manufacturers
content: GE Healthcare, Hologic, Siemens Healthineers, Philips Healthcare, Fujifilm, Agfa HealthCare

title: Primary Uses
content: Early detection and diagnosis of breast cancer. Reference: https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa1206809

title: Specialized Uses
content: Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT), Contrast-Enhanced Spectral Mammography, Photon-Counting Mammography. Reference: https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamainternalmedicine/article-abstract/2822381

title: Safety Concerns
content: Radiation-induced cancer risk, pregnancy concerns, breast implants, and post-treatment limitations. Reference: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20736332/

title: Common Preprocessing Steps
content: Noise reduction, image enhancement, pectoral muscle removal. Reference: https://openbiomedicalengineeringjournal.com/VOLUME/16/ELOCATOR/e187412072209200/FULLTEXT/

title: Compression Methods (if any)
content: Lossless and lossy compression supported. Reference: https://ajronline.org/doi/10.2214/AJR.14.12912

title: Technical Challenges
content: Artifacts, breast positioning, dense tissue masking lesions. Reference: https://ajronline.org/doi/10.2214/AJR.10.7246

title: Clinical Limitations
content: False-positives, false-negatives, overdiagnosis, radiation risk. Reference: https://eurjmedres.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s40001-015-0140-6
